content: update 1/24/2021 offering this pattern for free as of right now update 1/25/2021 fixed minor mistake in color chart please redownload 100% of proceeds will go toward meals on wheels vermont a charity chosen by bernie sanders himself yarn i used álafosslopi by ístex in colors 0867 chocolate heather approx 50 m 0085 oatmeal heather approx 50 m 9973 wheat heather approx 25 m and 0051 white approx 25 m you may substitute for any other bulky weight yarn that is 100% wool and meets the correct gauge this pattern creates an oversized mitten that you will shrink down to the proper size by felting in the washing machine so you should avoid superwash wool yarn which is designed to not felt when washed size this is a one size mitten pattern that will fit most adult hands the mittens will be very oversized but once felted will shrink down the longer you leave the mittens to felt the smaller the mittens will become if you do not want to felt your mittens you may want to consider playing with a smaller gauge/yarn/needles to achieve a smaller mitten experiment to your heart s content needles i used us 10 6 00mm dpns for the whole pattern but you may knit the body of the mitten using a circular needle gauge 13 stitches = 4 in 10 cm with us 10 6 00mm acknowledgments bernie sanders for his excellent service to the state of vermont and the nation jen ellis the vermont schoolteacher who designed the first pair of bernie mittens nordligeskog my colorwork charts are modified versions of the ones posted originally by this reddit user unn søiland dale this ravelry user s freely available pattern marius tova votter was my inspiration to design a felted mitten thanks to ravelry users barbsve and adenby for translating this pattern from norwegian to english all the knitters whose tutorials are linked in this pattern thank you for all your help giving us visuals to work by if you would like me to take the links out of this pattern please let me know and i will do so this is my first pattern design please let me know if you spot any mistakes suggestions are welcome
